intro: Rinorea thonneri, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a dense layer of fine, silky hairs, giving it a velvety texture. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It is native to regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Rinorea thonneri is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage.
